Summary: There are a couple of computers and a pool table in the communal area. There are a number of good restaurants in the Four Points Sheraton next door and a massive mall about a block away that has other dining options.
The Ascott Beijing is located in a building with several restaurants, art galleries, a massage place, a convenience store, and a tea house. The breakfast is served in the Casa Mia Italian restaurant.
The Autumn Garden Hotel has a friendly staff that speaks English and is very helpful. The hotel provides a map, a mobile phone to use during your stay, and a tricycle service to the main road.

Many reviewers mention the hotel's proximity to restaurants, bars, and the Houhai Lake area, which offers public dancing and singing. Some reviews note that most guests are older tourists who travel in groups.

Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with multiple bedrooms, living rooms, and dining areas, which can accommodate large groups. The hotel has a small restaurant and is located across the street from a large supermarket.
The hotel has a coffee shop with character, also serving as a bar. There is also a karaoke bar and nightclub.

The hostel part of the Far East International Youth Hostel has a courtyard that acts as a communal meeting space where travelers can socialize. There is also a basement bar in the hotel with internet access where people can hang out and watch movies.
The Friendship Hotel has multiple restaurants including a TGI Friday's, a pub, and a beer garden. It is a large complex with underground walkways connecting buildings and shopping counters.
The hotel is near a food street adjacent to it, and in the embassy district. The lobby is clean and 5 star-ish.
The Beijing Hotel is connected to the Raffles Hotel, and guests can access facilities like the tennis court, bowling alley, pool, and billiard room for a fee. The lobby can be crowded and busy.
The hotel has a bar on the second floor, but limited seating in the lobby. The hotel is often used by tour groups.

The hostel has a huge common area with TV, stereo, couches, and books, as well as a popular bar/lounge with movies, cheap beer, and table football. However, some reviewers noted that the hostel doesn't necessarily have a strong social atmosphere.

Sihe Hotel has a courtyard where guests can meet and compare experiences, and breakfast is also a social event where adventurers trade hints each morning. The hotel is small and intimate, and the courtyard can be a great location to make contacts with other travelers.
The hotel has 4-5 restaurants and is close to shopping centers and local restaurants. There is no hotel bar and all restaurants close at 10 pm.
The hotel has 3 bars, a bowling alley, and several superb restaurants including a Sichuan and a northern Chinese restaurant. The lobby is enormous, and there is a live fish tank in the lobby.
The China World Hotel has a grand and spacious lobby with live music, and is connected to a shopping mall with a variety of restaurants. There is also a tea lounge in the lobby.
The hotel is next door to several good pubs and local restaurants that cater to foreigners, and staff encouraged strangers to sit with you at breakfast.

The hotel consists of individual houses that have separate bedrooms with bathrooms and a shared living room/kitchen, and some villas can be rented as a whole or by room. Some reviewers found the communal spaces ideal for large families, while others would not want to share with strangers.

Courtyard 7 is located off Nanluoguxiang, a street with designer shops, bars, and restaurants, and is near clubs like Mao Live House and Yu Gong Yi Shan. The hotel courtyard is a place to socialize, and some rooms have private courtyards.
The hotel is connected to the New World Shopping Center, which includes fast food chains, a food court, a supermarket and a gym. There is a bar/lounge on the ground floor.
The hotel restaurant's breakfast buffet is a social gathering point for business travelers, both Western and Chinese. There is a bar downstairs.
The hotel has a bar in the lobby that is a nice place to get a quick drink. Guests in executive club rooms can meet other interesting people from different parts of the world in a private lounge.
The hotel has a Club Lounge where guests can relax and enjoy drinks and refreshments. There are multiple restaurants including Valley Cafe which provides a breakfast buffet.

The hotel has a bar that offers good international sports coverage on TV but was virtually empty during stays. It also has a club lounge with free drinks and nibbles for 2 hours at night, but it was very quiet.
Multiple restaurants are in the hotel, including a Brazilian restaurant. There are also restaurants and a small shopping area within a 5-10 minute walk.

The hotel has evening live music in the lobby, and several restaurants are housed in an adjoining complex. One reviewer mentioned that at times there seemed to be more staff waiting to serve than guests.
I am sorry, but none of the hotel reviews mention opportunities for socializing.
The hotel has a buffet breakfast at the 4th floor with a wide variety of foods. There is a mini-golf course on the 2nd floor.

The Double Happiness Courtyard Hotel has a cosy little bar, a small courtyard, and a lounge where guests can relax and chat. Some reviewers mention meeting other travelers and even Olympic athletes at the hotel.
The hotel has a bar on the ground floor that serves drinks and an executive lounge that serves evening hors d'oeuvres and drinks. The hotel also has a restaurant.
The Empark Grand Hotel has a Vegas-like mall in the basement with restaurants, boutiques, and a spa. There is also a gym and pool that is free for VIP guests.
I am sorry, but there is no information about opportunities for socializing at the Fujian Hotel in these reviews.
The hotel caters to large tour groups and may lack attention to individual guests. The hotel has a grand entrance and lounge area where you can have a coffee or drink and watch people.
The hotel has an atrium with live music in the evenings and a fountain bar. There is also a lounge on the 3rd floor for reading and relaxing.
The Grand Hyatt Beijing has a lobby lounge that is a great place to meet people. The Red Moon bar offers live music and is a comfortable lounge place.
The hotel has a lobby bar popular with Westerners, and a lobby with free WIFI and comfortable seating. There is also a V9 restaurant with buffet-style food.

The Grand Millennium has a ground floor lobby lounge with live music and a bar, but the bar's atmosphere may not appeal to everyone. Some reviewers mentioned meeting people on tours arranged by the hotel.
The hotel has a bar, 3 restaurants, a disco, snooker table, and bowling alley. Breakfast is served in 3 rooms that double as restaurants.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention opportunities for socializing.
Reviews mention that there is no real social scene at the hotel and that the bar is minimal and not comfortable. There is a small bar in the lobby which is rarely used.
The Hebei Guest House is located in a traditional hutong neighborhood. The hotel has multiple buildings, some rooms open up to courtyards, and it is within walking distance of the Houhai bar area.

The hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, including an executive lounge where free beverages, including top-shelf cocktails, are served. The lobby cafes are also good places to meet business clients.

The Hilton Beijing Wangfujing has a bar called Flames on the fifth floor that is designed to attract the trendy, well-heeled young Beijing crowd and hosts local business networking nights. The Executive Lounge on the 16th floor is larger than some lounges and has a managers ‘cocktail hour’.

The Holiday Inn Lido has a pub called The Pig & Thistle, which some reviewers mentioned had a lively atmosphere with many people. The hotel also has multiple restaurants and bars, which could provide opportunities for socializing.

The hotel has an executive lounge where travelers can socialize in the evenings, and the hotel concierge, Storm, occasionally takes guests to dinner at local restaurants. A reviewer also noted that a small group tour allowed them to socialize with people from several countries.
The hotel has multiple restaurants and an executive lounge that offers free food and drinks. Some reviewers mention that the staff is very friendly and makes them feel at home.
The hotel has an executive lounge, a bar, and a swimming pool. There are several restaurants nearby including a Pizza Hut, Sizzler and McDonalds.

The hotel attracts many domestic bus tour groups, and most customers are Chinese tour groups, with a smattering of business types and Westerners. There are five computers by the lobby that are available 24/7.
I am sorry, but none of the hotel reviews contain information about opportunities for socializing.

The hotel is located above the Focus Mall and across the road from Stellar International Cineplex which has approximately 20 restaurants, a liquor store, and a department store with a supermarket. The hotel is next to Hua Tang Shopping Center, which has many restaurants.
The hotel has a KTV karaoke lounge with private booths. The executive lounge offers snacks and two free alcoholic drinks daily during a designated happy hour.
The reviews mention that not many Westerners stay at this hotel. Additionally, thin walls may allow guests to hear neighbors.
The hotel has a lounge and courtyard where guests can relax and socialize. Breakfast is communal in a stunning room.

Hotel G has a bar (Scarlett) that is a great night venue and has theme parties, which helps people meet each other; the hotel is close to many bars and clubs. The hotel is a place where you can meet local celebrities and glitterati, and the live singers are really good.

The hotel has a bar, but it is smoke-filled and pricey; a 24-hour snack bar and a cafeteria are available, but there are not many dining or shopping options around the hotel. Free internet is available in the lobby.
The Kunlun Hotel has multiple restaurants and bars, and an executive level with free food on the top floor. Some reviewers mentioned meeting helpful staff who recommended local spots.
The hotel has a lobby bar and multiple restaurants, including a Japanese restaurant. The hotel also has a lounge, though it is a bit small.
The hotel is connected to a shopping mall with a range of restaurants and a karaoke club and has a lobby lounge. The executive floor has a separate lounge.
The hotel is near Sanlitun bar Street and has restaurants within walking distance. The lobby lounge is not well-developed.

The reviews mention that the hotel is located in a busy shopping district with many restaurants and fast food options nearby, but it is not in a touristy area and has few non-Chinese people. One review mentions the possibility of meeting English speakers through Lindy Hopping (Swing Dancing) in Beijing.
The hotel has a lobby bar with live piano music. The hotel has several dining options including a Chinese restaurant and a buffet restaurant.

The Intercontinental Beijing has a club lounge that opens from 5 PM to 8 PM with a selection of hot and cold finger foods and drinks. There is also a Steak Exchange that has a piano player from Tuesday till Saturday, playing jazz music.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention opportunities for socializing.
The hotel lobby hosts a cafe serving fresh loose leaf teas. Charlie's Bar offers live music in the evenings.
The hotel has a bar on the 2nd floor and a theatre with Beijing opera performances. The lobby is described as not having a welcoming bar spot to relax and socialize.
The hotel has a bar, and the ground floor includes a restaurant and other businesses like a travel agency and hair salon. There is also a "Western" themed restaurant with a bar and pool table.
The hotel has a lobby bar where the barman is a good snooker player. The hotel is attached to the Joy City shopping mall which has restaurants.

The hotel has several eateries, including a steak house with a wine bar, a French venue, a bistro, and a spacious general lounge. There is also a casino promotion with card tables in the bar on the first level.

Based on the reviews, Hotel Kapok has a bar in the lobby, and is located near a night food market and Wangfujing shopping street, which may provide opportunities for socializing outside the hotel. However, some reviews mention the lobby bar lacks atmosphere and there isn't a functional coffee shop.
Kelly's Courtyard has a rooftop terrace for relaxing and a glass-covered courtyard where breakfast is served. The staff is helpful and known to socialize with guests.
The Kempinski Lufthansa Centre has a bar that is a frequent meeting point for business travelers. It also has multiple restaurants including a German bar, Paulaner, with outdoor seating.

The Kuntai Royal Hotel is near Sanlitun, an evening entertainment area with bars featuring live bands, and a latin bar/lounge called "Mojito" is around the corner. A fashion mall is diagonally across from the hotel.
Lee Gardens Service Apartment has a gym, pool, and restaurant. There is a cafe in the basement.

I am sorry, but the provided hotel reviews don't offer information about socializing opportunities at the Legendale Hotel in Beijing. Therefore, I am unable to provide a summary that addresses the query.
The hotel has many excellent on-site restaurants, a bowling alley, an indoor pool, and a spa. The hotel restaurants offer a wide range of cuisines.

The hotel hosted a free party to celebrate the Moon Festival, and guests were transferred to a hutong cafe. Some reviewers mention meeting people who have lived at the Luxury Serviced Residence for years.

Many reviewers noted that the hotel is located a bit far from the city center and tourist attractions, though it is near the Olympic Park/Bird's Nest. Some reviews mention neighborhood restaurants within a 5-minute walk and affordable eating options near the hotel.

The hotel has an Executive lounge with perks like free internet, breakfast, happy hour with drinks and snacks, and 24/7 coffee and tea. There is a Bally's Fitness Center connected to the hotel, and the pool area is shared with Bally's members.

The hotel offers spacious 2-bedroom apartments with fully equipped kitchens and a 6-chair dining table, making it suitable for receiving clients. It is connected to a shopping center via a 10-minute taxi ride, which includes restaurants.

The hotel has a lobby bar and the Ruby Bar, though the Ruby Bar was not yet open during the time of the reviews. Some reviewers mention that the bars and restaurants lacked atmosphere due to the hotel not being very busy.

The hotel staff is very friendly, helpful, and eager to assist guests, and the general manager is visible and makes guests feel at home. The hotel has a bar where guests can socialize, and the staff is willing to stay up late with guests.

Michael's House is a cozy courtyard-style hotel with a comfortable lounge area that encourages guests to befriend each other. The hotel's small size and traditional style can create a familiar atmosphere for socializing and exchanging travel tips.
I am sorry, but the provided hotel reviews do not mention any opportunities for socializing. Therefore, I cannot create a summary that answers your question.
The hotel has a lobby bar/cafe that is a good meeting place. The hotel deals with large groups of tourists.

The New Century Hotel's breakfast is served at the function room on the 4th floor with huge round tables covered by old pink/orange tablecloth so you sit with people you don't know; the business center also offers a continental breakfast in the morning, with snacks and free wine/beer in the afternoon. One reviewer mentioned doing business by showing up early and nibbling through the entire breakfast service as different contacts came and went.

The hotel has a bar with a pianist, a lobby lounge, and happy hour with free drinks and hor d'oeuvres on the Club level. Some reviewers mention meeting with friends in the hotel and feeling welcome in the bar.
The hotel's executive level offered a happy hour with free drinks and snacks in the executive lounge. The hotel had a gallery bar with a live jazz pianist that doubled as an art gallery.

Oakwood Residence Beijing is located near modern shopping malls, restaurants, and bars, and has restaurants and shops within the complex. The hotel has a spa called "Taipan" and offers a breakfast buffet.
I am sorry, but the provided hotel reviews do not contain information about opportunities for socializing. Therefore, I cannot generate a summary based on this query.

The hotel has a bar in the lobby, and is located near nightlife, bars, and restaurants in the Hutong area by the lake. A 24-hour restaurant is available, and the hotel offers conference center facilities.

The Oriental Culture Hotel has a lobby with a seating area, fountain, piano, and palm trees, and it offers facilities such as a swimming pool, gym, bowling alley, and snooker rooms. A ground floor restaurant sells local beer and allows customers to drink there without ordering food.

The hotel has a garden complex next door which is free to hotel guests and appears to be a central point for early morning exercises and games enjoyed by the Chinese. There are restaurants and a bar street within walking or taxi distance.

The hotel is a long-term executive hotel where breakfast is included, offering a place to meet other expats staying in the building; the GM aims to make guests feel like part of a family. The hotel also has a Manager's reception each evening.

The Park Hyatt Beijing has a bar, China Grill, and Lobby Lounge, which are located on the highest floors offering city views. The bar situation was a little weird, in terms of them reserving bar stools for people for hours that never showed.

The hotel has a cozy lobby bar with live music at times, a "Beer Garden," and is located near hot pot and Cantonese restaurants. Some reviewers mentioned that the staff were friendly and created a welcoming environment.
I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention opportunities for socializing.

Some reviewers mentioned sharing tables with strangers at breakfast due to crowded seating, and that the lobby area contains a bar. A reviewer also noted meeting a lot of Israeli guests who shared similar opinions about the hotel.
The hotel lobby has a couple of lounges where guests can sit, have a drink or tea, and smoke. The coffee shop/bar is often busy, and the hotel seems popular with local businessmen.
The hotel has a cozy bar, an executive lounge with happy hour, and a restaurant with a buffet. There is a shopping mall next to the hotel with (fast) restaurants.
The hotel is located on a street with many restaurants and is within walking distance of subway stations. A supermarket is located on the ground floor.
The Raffles Beijing has a spacious lobby and bar. There is a happy hour every evening in the bar and the Raffles Inc Executive lounge offers complimentary tea and drinks daily.

The hotel has a bar on the 4th floor, but the staff there is not very familiar with English. Club level rooms provide access to a lounge for complimentary breakfast, evening cocktails, and appetizers.
The hotel has a bar lounge with live music and a club lounge that provides a quiet place to relax. There are many restaurants and bars with a local atmosphere near the hotel.

The Shangri-La Beijing has a Valley Wing with a business lounge that serves complimentary food and drinks and an open bar during happy hour. The Horizon Club lounge is also accessible, offering an assortment of snacks, desserts, and drinks.
The Kerry Centre features a wine bar, a coffee bar, and Centro bar which is a "hot spot" attracting locals. The Horizon Club offers a complimentary happy hour with drinks and snacks.

A reviewer mentioned a pub called 'No Name' in the Xicheng district, and another mentioned the Alley Cafe which has a western menu, free internet, and a pet cat. Additionally, Jingshan Park is a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, where locals gather in groups to exercise, play music, sing, and dance.

The Sofitel Wanda Beijing has multiple restaurants and bars, including the M Bar which is noted as an amazing venue. The hotel is located between two large shopping centers and close to good bars and restaurants in the CBD District.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention any opportunities for socializing in the hotel.

The Spring Garden Hotel has a downstairs breakfast area and karaoke machine available for guests, and also offers dumpling-making as an activity. The hotel has a courtyard where guests can eat, relax, and listen to music.
I am sorry, but the reviews do not contain information about opportunities for socializing at the hotel. Therefore, I cannot provide a summary based on the query.
The Swissotel Beijing has a lobby bar, and is located near the San Li Tun bar district. The hotel also has several restaurants, including a cafe and a beer garden.

Templeside Deluxe Hutong House has a central courtyard that doubles as an eating area and a place to meet fellow travelers. The hotel offers dumpling-making sessions and opportunities to dine with the owner and staff.
The hotel is located a 45-minute drive from the heart of Beijing. There is an ante-room connecting suites, and guests have access to a library.
The hotel has a rooftop bar with views over Beijing, though it can be quiet depending on the time of year. The hotel is located in a neighborhood area, within walking distance of restaurants.

The Opposite House is located in Sanlitun, known for its restaurants and bars, and has a bar/club downstairs called Punk. The hotel also has a bar on the ground floor that has some nice signature cocktails and a good vibe.

Some reviewers enjoyed meeting other club members and enjoyed drinks and food in quiet comfort in the Club Lounge, while others said that the Lobby bar is a little disappointing and seems like an afterthought. The Lobby bar is a meeting place for young, hip, rich Beijingers, foreign journos, other expats and Chinese business people.
I am sorry, but the provided reviews contain no mention of opportunities for socializing at the Regent Beijing hotel.
The hotel has a lobby tea cafe and a lobby bar seating area. There is also a club floor with a lounge that has free flowing drinks and food.

The hotel has a bar/lounge that is comfortable, provides nibblers, and plays different music each night. There are also many restaurants and Western chains like Starbucks and Fauchon within a few minutes walk.
The St. Regis Beijing has a lobby bar and lounge area with live Asian music. It also has a bowling alley and several restaurants.

The hotel has a few interesting bars and restaurants, and is near the Sanlitun diplomatic quarter with shopping and nightlife. There is an executive lounge on the top floor which offers evening finger-food and drinks.
The hotel has an executive lounge that provides a quiet zone and meeting space. The lounge staff are friendly and treat customers like friends.

The Sunworld Dynasty Hotel (formerly Tianlun Dynasty) has a large internal atrium with music, dining, and a bar, which is a great place to sit, have a drink, and connect to the internet. The hotel also has karaoke bars and lounges, although these are managed by a third party.
The hotel restaurant offers a breakfast buffet and other meals. The lobby has a small bar.
Tiantan Hotel has a cafe, two restaurants, and a karaoke bar. One restaurant offers a free breakfast buffet with both Eastern and Western options.

The Traders Hotel is connected to the China World complex, providing access to a high-end mall and restaurants. There are also two other hotels within walking distance owned by the same company, allowing guests to sign meals to their rooms.
I am sorry, the provided hotel reviews do not contain information about opportunities for socializing.

The hotel has a nightclub with show girls/escorts and a lobby lounge, and is located close to shops, restaurants, and karaoke. The executive level offered light snacks and drinks in a comfortable lounge.
The hotel has several restaurants, Korean/Japanese/Izakaya restaurants, a bar, and a pub. It hosts conventions and seminars and has a bowling alley.
The hotel has an 8-lane bowling alley, table tennis, and pool tables. There is no trendy cocktail bar.

The Xinyuan Inn is located in a modern, touristy hutong, described as a fun and active area, offering a more authentic Chinese travel experience. Breakfast is included, and there are nearby stores and a traditional Chinese breakfast restaurant.
The XiXI Youyi Hotel is located near the Xidan shopping district, with many restaurants in the building. Some reviewers mentioned the hotel staff was friendly and attentive.
Multiple restaurants are available including a revolving restaurant, grill room, and "food street" in a nearby building. The hotel seems to cater primarily to Chinese businessmen.
The hotel primarily caters to Chinese conference attendees and business travelers, though Western guests are also seen. The hotel is located near local restaurants that cater to students.
The hotel has a restaurant, cafe, and courtyard, and reviewers mention camaraderie amongst guests, especially during the Olympics. It has a youth hostel feel and attracts a cross-section of visitors.
